Job Title: Control Systems and Electrical Design Lead

Location: Fountain Valley, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:

Job details

Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Easy Apply" button and sending us your resume.

Salary $32 - $66 per hour

A Bit About Us

A premier firm in the oil and gas industry is seeking a self-motivated and energetic applicant to apply for an Electrical & Control Systems Design Lead position in Southern California.



Why join us?


We offer a competitive benefits package that includes health, dental, and vision insurance, as well as retirement plans and flexible spending accounts. Our benefits are designed to meet your individual needs and support your overall well-being.

The position has a flexible 9/80 work schedule with a hybrid work location, supporting the Fountain Valley office.

Job Details

About The Position

In this position, you will apply your knowledge of the principles of electrical & control systems design to

Lead the development of industrial construction drawings, including single line diagrams, area classification diagrams, grounding, lighting, conduit/cable tray, schematics and wiring diagrams, cable/conduit schedules, installation details, PLC panel layout and I/O schematics, loop diagrams and control system architecture.

Work in a team environment with electrical engineers and other disciplines (e.g. project management, piping, mechanical, civil, structural, etc.) to develop solutions to clients’ multi-discipline project needs.

Responsibilities

Your core duties and responsibilities may require you to do the following

Lead the electrical & control systems design development for simple projects, managing other designers and drafters as needed.

Support Principal Electrical & Control Systems Designers on large and complex projects.

Perform site visits to gather field data and verify existing facilities and project requirements.

Use software tools to perform design calculations such as cable tray sizing, conduit sizing, duct bank sizing, voltage drops, etc.

Support the development of design labor estimate for new projects.

Keep track of project budgets, schedules and change orders.

Develop construction drawings and material requirements.

Prioritize and manage multiple tasks/projects with various due dates. Attend coordination and status meetings.

Develop and maintain good professional relationship with clients.

Skill Requirements

Strong Verbal And Written Communication Skills Are Required.

Strong proficiency with AutoCAD is required.

Working Experience With Electrical Construction Is Required.

Proficiency with additional 3D Design software, including Civil 3D, Plant 3D and AVEVA E3D is strongly preferred.

Proficiency with MicroStation is preferred.

Ability to visit local project sites for data gathering and inspections with occasional travel to farther locations is required.

Valid driver’s license and clean driving record is required.

Experience And Education Requirements

10+ years designing projects involving medium and low voltage power systems, grounding, lighting, instrumentation and control systems.

Energy Infrastructure Experience Is Preferred.

Engineering consulting experience is preferred.

Working knowledge with instrumentation, programmable logic controllers (PLC) and distributed control systems (DCS) is preferred.

Candidates must be knowledgeable in electrical design, NEC and API 500.

Formal training in electrical and control system design is preferred. Trade school or associates degree is preferred, or equivalent experience.
